title: Understanding Spontaneity
text: To determine if a reaction is spontaneous, consider the relationship between enthalpy (ΔH), entropy (ΔS), and temperature (T).

title: Gibbs Free Energy Equation
text: Recall the Gibbs Free Energy equation: $$ΔG=\Delta H-T \Delta S$$. A reaction is spontaneous if ΔG is negative.

title: Positive Entropy Change
text: If ΔS is positive, the term $$-T \Delta S$$ will be negative, which can help make ΔG negative.

title: Balancing Enthalpy and Entropy
text: For the reaction to be spontaneous, the negative contribution from $$-T \Delta S$$ must outweigh the positive ΔH.

title: Final Condition for Spontaneity
text: The condition $$\Delta H<T \Delta S$$ ensures that the negative entropy term is large enough to make ΔG negative, leading to spontaneity.
